timeline.message:
chore(broker): remove maxSnapshotCount config setting

This commit removes the maxSnapshotCount configuration setting from the
DataCfg. From now on we can asume there is always only a maximum of 1
snapshot present at any time.

timeline.bodyText: I think this would work also if the latest is the same as the previous right? It then returns and I think it is a bit misleading that it says waitForNew.. ?
timeline.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText:
No that is not correct. Either previousSnapshot is null, in which case it is enough to just find a snapshot. Or previousSnapshot is not null, in which case latestSnapshot.map(previousSnapshot::compareTo).orElse(0) needs to be -1 for the latest to actually be newer than the previous. The compareTo will return 0 if the previousSnapshot and the latestSnapshot are the same.
I've tried an early return (with exceptional cases first) approach to this method. So only in the last return return true it will have actually found something and stop waiting.
replies.author: korthout
Zelldon

replies.bodyText:
It's actually:
latestSnapshot.map(latestSnapshot -> previousSnapshot.compareTo(latestSnapshot)).orElse(0)
replies.author: korthout

replies.bodyText:
So,
if latest is empty, the result 0.
If previous is before latest, the result is -1.
If previous is the same as latest, the result is 0.
If previous is after latest, the result is 1.
replies.author: korthout

replies.bodyText: Only the case where previous is before the latest (or in other words, the latest is actually the newest) it stops waiting
replies.author: korthout

replies.bodyText: Ok sorry I get it now. As you can see it was for me not easy to understand 😅  I always find this streaming api and compare a bit confusing 😅 But might be just me. If it is actually previousSnapshot.compareTo(latestSnapshot) then yes it makes sense otherwise it would not 😅
replies.author: Zelldon

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, streaming api can be confusing (just remember that it is a method reference, so in this case it will apply the provided method with the values in the Optional/Stream as argument).
I have to add that I also wrote it a little confusing, but I wanted to maintain a return early approach. Perhaps I can have another look at it, to make it less confusing.

timeline.message:
chore(broker): remove maxSnapshotCount config setting

This commit removes the maxSnapshotCount configuration setting from the
DataCfg. From now on we can asume there is always only a maximum of 1
snapshot present at any time.

docs(broker): change snapshot config description

Removing maxSnapshotCount removes the way we discuss deletion of logs
because don't have to consider a count anymore, but can just say that a
snapshot is enough. A log is truncated when it is part of a known
snapshot.

docs(broker): change snapshot config description

Removing maxSnapshotCount removes the way we discuss deletion of logs
because don't have to consider a count anymore, but can just say that a
snapshot is enough. A log is truncated when it is part of a known
snapshot.

docs(broker): change snapshot config description

Removing maxSnapshotCount removes the way we discuss deletion of logs
because don't have to consider a count anymore, but can just say that a
snapshot is enough. A log is truncated when it is part of a known
snapshot.
